body.p: You can import transformation and validation scenarios from various sources (such as properties, projects, frameworks, and scenarios files). You can also export the global transformation and validation scenarios into specialized scenarios files. The following actions are available:

ul.li: To load a set of transformation scenarios from a file, use the Options Import Transformation Scenarios action.

To load a set of transformation scenarios from a file, , go to Scenarios Management, and click on the Import Global Transformation Scenarios button. The imported scenarios will be saved into the user global-level options.
To store a set of global (not project-level) transformation scenarios in a scenarios file, use the Options Export Global Transformation Scenarios action.
To store a set of global (not project-level) transformation scenarios in a scenarios file, , go to Scenarios Management, and click on the Export Global Transformation Scenarios button.
To load a set of validation scenarios from a file, use the Options Import Validation Scenarios action.

To load a set of validation scenarios from a file, , go to Scenarios Management, and click on the Import Global Validation Scenarios button. The imported scenarios will be saved into the user global-level options.
To store a set of global (not project-level) validation scenarios in a scenarios file, use the Options Export Global Validation Scenarios action.
To store a set of global (not project-level) validation scenarios in a scenarios file, , go to Scenarios Management, and click on the Export Global Validation scenarios button.

body.p: The Export Global Transformation Scenarios and Export Global Validation Scenarios options are used to store all the scenarios in a separate file. Associations between document URLs and scenarios are also saved in this file. You can load the saved scenarios using the Import Transformation ScenariosImport Global Transformation Scenarios and Import Validation ScenariosImport Global Validation Scenarios actions. To distinguish the existing scenarios and the imported ones, the names of the imported scenarios contain the word import.
